text: The American Juvenile Electric was an electric car made in 1907. It was built by the American Metal Wheel & Auto Co of Toledo, Ohio. Its wheelbase was . It came with lights and bells like a normal car. It used tiller steering for turning. It could move up to . The car could go on one charge. In 1907, it cost $800. This cost more than many cars at the time. == References == * G. Marshall Naul, "American Juvenile Electric", in G.N. Georgano, ed., The Complete Encyclopedia of Motorcars 1885-1968 (New York: E.P. Dutton and Co., 1974), pp. 42\. title: American Juvenile Electric
